job_description:
Business Analyst

The Business Analyst plays a key role in ensuring requirements are clearly understood, accurately documented, and traceable throughout the software development lifecycle. This role focuses on translating business and functional inputs into structured, standardized documentation that supports effective development, testing, and delivery. Working closely with business analysts, design teams, and technical stakeholders, the role ensures consistency, clarity, and alignment across all requirement artifacts.

Key Responsibilities

  • Create Software Requirement Specifications (SRS) based on inputs from Core Business Analysts, stakeholder discussions, and requirement walkthroughs
  • Prepare Business Requirement Documents (BRD) using approved templates while ensuring business intent and system behavior are clearly documented
  • Participate in requirement discussions to understand business objectives, functional flows, dependencies, and assumptions before documentation
  • Analyze requirements to identify gaps, ambiguities, and inconsistencies, and work with Core BAs to resolve them
  • Document functional flows, business rules, and acceptance criteria where applicable to support development and QA teams
  • Document wireframes, UI flows, validations, and UI specifications in collaboration with design and product teams
  • Maintain change logs, version history, and document updates throughout the project lifecycle
  • Create and manage traceability matrices linking business, functional, and technical requirements
  • Maintain cross-references across BRD, SRS, UI, API, and related documentation
  • Ensure documentation consistency, completeness, and alignment with approved scope and delivery timelines
  • Ensure accurate and timely PMS updates with structured documentation details
  • Support development, QA, UAT, and audit processes through clear, traceable, and up-to-date documentation
  • Assist in requirement reviews, walkthroughs, and validation sessions with internal and client stakeholders

Requirements

Required Skills and Experience

  • 1 to 4 years of experience in Business Analysis documentation or related roles
  • Strong experience in BRD and SRS creation
  • Hands-on experience with documentation templates, standards, and version control
  • Ability to document UI wireframes and functional flows clearly
  • Working knowledge of APIs and system integrations for documentation purposes
  • Experience with project management systems and documentation tools
  • Strong attention to detail and ability to manage multiple documents in parallel
  • Excellent written communication and stakeholder coordination skills

Minimum Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field
  • 1 to 4 years of experience as a Business Analyst or Product Analyst

Benefits

  • A growth-driven environment with opportunities to lead, innovate, and upskill continuously.

If this opportunity aligns with your career goals, kindly share your updated resume with us at careers@2basetechnologies.com.
summary: Translates business needs into structured documentation for software development. Ensures clarity, traceability, and alignment across requirements artifacts.

job_description:
Senior Business Analyst

At 2Base, we are rebuilding the Business Analyst function into a world-class, product-minded, clarity-driven team. This role is not a documentation role. It is not a screen updater role. It is not a support role. This is a core Business Analyst position responsible for functional modelling, system reasoning, requirement clarity, and building the foundation for correct development.

As a Senior Business Analyst, you will be the functional brain of the project. You will ensure that the right problem is understood, broken down, analysed, validated, clarified, communicated, and owned end-to-end. You will drive requirement precision, reduce rework, and enable confident and aligned delivery across teams.

Key Responsibilities

  • Lead requirement workshops, client calls, and discovery discussions to understand business needs clearly.
  • Ask deeper questions, challenge assumptions, and validate the true business intent behind every requirement.
  • Convert ambiguous client inputs into structured, logical, and actionable functional understanding.
  • Break large features into modules, workflows, components, and clear dependencies.
  • Build strong system-level understanding involving APIs, integrations, data flow, and backend considerations.
  • Translate business processes into functional logic that development teams can execute.
  • Decompose requirements into use-case flows, system behaviours, edge cases, alternate paths, validation rules, and dependencies.
  • Prepare high-quality documentation, including BRD, FRD, SRS, workflows, state diagrams, data-flow diagrams, API requirement specs, and acceptance criteria.
  • Ensure all documentation is clear, logical, structured, testable, and ready for developers and QA to use.
  • Collaborate closely with developers, architects, QA, and product owners to validate feasibility and align understanding.
  • Ensure QA teams can derive test cases effectively from your functional logic and acceptance criteria.
  • Communicate confidently with clients, handle requirement discussions smoothly, and clarify misunderstandings immediately.
  • Push back politely on unclear or changing requirements and ensure final decisions are documented properly.
  • Maintain requirement traceability throughout the lifecycle and ensure zero ambiguity during handover to development.
  • Own the entire requirement lifecycle from discovery to development readiness with high accountability.
  • Drive clarity across teams by ensuring every requirement is complete, validated, and logically consistent.

Required Skills & Experience

  • Minimum 4+ years of core Business Analyst experience with strong analytical and system-level thinking.
  • Ability to break down complex requirements into clear components, workflows, and functional logic.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication with confidence in client interactions and clarifications.
  • Proven experience in preparing SRS, BRD, FRD, workflows, and acceptance criteria with high clarity.
  • Ability to challenge assumptions politely, ask the right questions, and ensure zero ambiguity.
  • Strong collaboration experience with development, QA, architects, and cross-functional teams.
  • Understanding of API behaviours, integrations, data flows, and multi-module system interactions.
  • Ability to run requirement discussions, workshops, and independently lead discovery sessions.
  • Exposure to SaaS, scalable products, automation, or AI-supported systems is an added advantage.
  • Demonstrated ownership of requirements end-to-end, ensuring developer-ready and testable outputs.
  • Not suitable for UI-only thinkers, passive communicators, template-based writers, or those relying on AI for answers.
  • Success is defined by clear, testable requirements, zero rework, strong cross-team alignment, and confident communication.
  • Candidates must align with 2Base’s structured thinking, clarity-driven culture, and transformation of the BA function.

Minimum Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Business, or related field
  • 4 to 8 years of experience as a Business Analyst or Product Analyst
  • Experience in SaaS or scalable product environments
  • Exposure to AI/Automation, integrations, or multi-module systems
  • Ability to run independent client workshops
  • Must have independently handled requirement ownership for at least one full project lifecycle

Benefits

  • A growth-driven environment with opportunities to lead, innovate, and upskill continuously.

If this opportunity aligns with your career goals, kindly share your updated resume with us at careers@2basetechnologies.com.
summary: A Senior Business Analyst role at 2Base focusing on functional modeling, system reasoning, and requirement clarity to drive aligned development. Requires 4+ years of core BA experience with SaaS and API expertise.

job_description:
Senior DevSecOps Engineer

We are seeking a Senior DevSecOps Engineer to lead cybersecurity, infrastructure automation, and DevSecOps practices as we transition to a secure, scalable, and modern engineering environment. This role will strengthen 2Base’s security posture, modernize pipelines, and foster a secure-by-design culture. You will collaborate with engineering, product, and leadership teams to ensure systems, applications, and cloud environments are secure, reliable, and future-ready.

Key Responsibilities

  • Define, implement, and enforce security standards, policies, and best practices across cloud and on-prem environments.
  • Conduct security risk assessments, vulnerability scans, penetration testing, and mitigation plans.
  • Architect and enhance secure CI/CD pipelines with automated compliance checkpoints.
  • Promote a "Security First" culture and ensure secure design/development practices.
  • Monitor, detect, investigate, and respond to security threats and breaches.
  • Develop Infrastructure-as-Code practices using Terraform, Ansible, and automation frameworks.
  • Design secure cloud architectures on AWS, Azure, or GCP.
  • Build and secure containerized environments with Docker and Kubernetes.
  • Implement secure monitoring, logging, SIEM, and alerting systems.
  • Optimize system reliability, scalability, performance, and fault tolerance.
  • Mentor DevOps engineers in secure development and operational excellence.
  • Lead technical strategy, tool selection, and DevSecOps roadmap execution.
  • Collaborate with BA, PM, and Engineering teams to align security and delivery goals.

Required Skills & Experience

  • 4–8 years of experience in DevOps, Cloud, or Infrastructure engineering with security exposure.
  • Hands-on CI/CD tools: Jenkins, GitLab CI, GitHub Actions.
  • Strong expertise in AWS, Azure, or GCP with secure architecture focus.
  • Proficiency in Infrastructure-as-Code (Terraform, Ansible).
  • Experience securing Docker and Kubernetes environments.
  • Networking knowledge: LAN/WAN, firewalls, VPN, load balancers.
  • Familiarity with security frameworks (OWASP, NIST, CIS Benchmarks).
  • Monitoring/logging tools: Prometheus, Grafana, ELK, CloudWatch, SIEM.
  • Scripting skills: Python, Bash, Shell.
  • Excellent troubleshooting, analytical, and communication skills.

Contact: Email your resume to careers@2basetechnologies.com.
summary: Lead cybersecurity and DevSecOps practices to modernize infrastructure, enforce security standards, and mentor teams in secure development.

job_description:
About Us

We are a growing technology company with strong foundations in mobile and web development, and an established focus on Artificial Intelligence. Our AI team is actively building intelligent, scalable, and data-driven solutions that enhance digital products across multiple domains. As we continue to expand our AI capabilities, we are looking for a passionate AI/ML Engineer to join our existing team and contribute to designing, developing, and deploying machine learning solutions that create real value for our clients and end users.

Key Responsibilities

  • Build Generative AI applications, including RAG-based and agentic AI systems, using LangChain/LangGraph, vector databases, and knowledge retrieval pipelines.
  • Work with Transformers and LLMs (e.g., LLaMA, Mistral) and hosted APIs (OpenAI, Google Gemini).
  • Implement and optimize machine learning algorithms and solutions using TensorFlow, PyTorch, and Scikit-learn.
  • Develop computer vision solutions (image processing, object detection, segmentation) using OpenCV and deep learning models.
  • Perform model evaluation, fine-tuning, and validation for production environments.
  • Collaborate with DevOps/MLOps to deploy and monitor models in production.
  • Stay updated with the latest research and industry trends in AI/ML.

Required Skills & Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Data Science, or a related field.
  • Hands-on experience in machine learning, deep learning, or Generative AI.
  • Strong Python programming skills.
  • Experience building Generative AI and RAG-based solutions with vector databases.
  • Proficiency with LangChain and LangGraph for LLM orchestration and agentic workflows.
  • Expertise in TensorFlow, PyTorch, and Scikit-learn.
  • Hands-on experience in computer vision techniques (object detection, segmentation) for custom datasets.
  • Strong knowledge of core ML algorithms (supervised, unsupervised, deep learning).
  • Experience developing and deploying ML/GenAI services using FastAPI or REST APIs.
  • Understanding of software engineering practices (version control, testing, CI/CD).

Preferred (Nice to Have)

  • Familiarity with agentic AI development using LangGraph for multi-step reasoning.
  • Experience with IoT and Edge AI, deploying models on edge devices (Raspberry Pi, NVIDIA Jetson).
  • Knowledge of containerization (Docker/Kubernetes).
  • Experience with cloud platforms (AWS/GCP/Azure) and ML services.

How to Apply

If this opportunity aligns with your career goals, kindly share your updated resume with us at career@newagesysindia.com.

job_description:
The Company

CTeBS, a subsidiary of Classic Fashion, is a leading software solution provider to the apparel manufacturing industry globally. Our suite of enterprise-level products, including our flagship Trendz CMP, leverages cutting-edge technology to enhance productivity, quality, and efficiency, ensuring our clients achieve unparalleled growth and success. Our journey with Classic Fashion has uniquely positioned us to design technology-enabled products and solutions for the ever-evolving needs of the apparel manufacturing sector, and we are poised for an exciting phase of growth.

Job Summary

We are looking for a hands-on Software Architect who is passionate about building scalable, high-performance software. In this role, you will serve as the bridge between high-level architectural vision and low-level code implementation. Unlike a pure manager, you will remain deeply involved in the code. You will own the technical design for major features, enforce coding standards, and solve the complex problems that stall development teams. You will work closely with the Associate Technical Manager (who handles delivery/metrics) while you ensure the technical integrity of the solution.

Responsibilities

  • Take full architectural responsibility for specific products or core modules (e.g., the Production Planning Engine or Payroll Calculation System).
  • Translate business requirements into technical design documents (TDDs), defining data models, API contracts, and class structures before coding begins.
  • Proactively identify "spaghetti code" or technical debt in our legacy Java/MSSQL systems and design safe refactoring plans to modernize them.
  • Be the final approver for critical code merges. You do not just check for bugs; you check for maintainability, security, and scalability.
  • Deep dive into database execution plans (Oracle/MSSQL) and application logic to optimize slow queries and reduce latency.
  • Enforce consistent design patterns (Singleton, Factory, Observer, etc.) across the development team to ensure the codebase remains uniform.
  • Act as the "Problem Solver in Chief" for the development team. When a developer is stuck on a complex logic issue, you provide the solution.
  • Mentor Senior Developers on how to write clean, efficient, and testable code. Conduct technical workshops on new frameworks or best practices.

Qualifications

  • 8 to 12 years of software development experience, with at least 2+ years in a Software Architect Role.
  • Expert in Java/J2EE (Spring, Hibernate, Multithreading).
  • Strong proficiency in MSSQL or Oracle (Stored Procedures, Indexing, Partitioning).
  • Solid understanding of Angular component architecture (even if you don't write CSS daily, you understand the data flow).
  • Strong grasp of Object-Oriented Design (OOD), Microservices patterns, and RESTful API design.
  • Experience with CI/CD pipelines (Jenkins/GitLab), Docker, and code quality tools (SonarQube).
  • Proven ability to debug complex production issues (memory leaks, thread deadlocks) under pressure.

Contact

If this opportunity aligns with your career goals, kindly share your updated resume with us at careers@ctebs.com.
summary: Hands-on Software Architect needed to design scalable solutions, mentor teams, and optimize legacy systems using Java, MSSQL/Oracle, and Angular.

  • Manage and mentor a team of digital marketers, setting clear objectives, performance standards, and guiding the team in executing high-impact campaigns.

  • Lead cross-functional teams to design and optimize marketing automation workflows and oversee CRM integrations for lead nurturing and conversion.
  • Analyse, interpret, and present campaign performance data, generating actionable insights to continuously improve campaigns.
  • Stay up to date with the latest trends, technologies, and best practices in digital marketing to ensure the company stays ahead of the curve.
  • Manage relationships with external vendors and agencies as needed for specialized projects or initiatives.
  • Own key performance indicators (KPIs), ensuring alignment with broader company goals, and drive continuous improvement based on data insights.

Skills You Need:

  • Advanced SEO Expertise: Proven experience in developing and executing advanced SEO strategies, including on-page, off-page, technical SEO (site audits, Core Web Vitals, schema markup, etc.), and local SEO.
  • Paid Media Mastery: Hands-on experience with Google Ads, Meta Ads, and other paid media platforms; expertise in campaign optimization, A/B testing, audience segmentation, and budget management.

Designation: Financial Analyst – R2R Experience: Strong hands-on experience in Record to Report (R2R) functions (Freshers please excuse) Closing Date: 28, Feb 2026 Published: 18, Feb 2026 Contact Email: careers@thebga.io

Role Overview

We are seeking a skilled Financial Analyst – R2R to manage and support financial reporting, reconciliations, and compliance activities for our SME clients. The ideal candidate will have strong practical exposure to month-end close processes, financial reporting, and reconciliations, along with proficiency in Xero and other ERP systems. This role requires ownership within the R2R cycle and the ability to ensure accurate, timely, and compliant financial reporting.

Key Responsibilities

  • General Ledger Management: Maintain and ensure the integrity of general ledger accounts. Execute month-end and year-end close activities, including journal entries, accruals, and adjustments. Review ledger postings for accuracy and compliance.
  • Reconciliations: Prepare and review monthly balance sheet reconciliations. Perform bank, AR, AP, VAT, payroll, and intercompany reconciliations. Identify and resolve reconciling items in a timely manner. Maintain proper documentation for audit readiness.
  • Financial Reporting: Prepare monthly, quarterly, and annual financial statements. Ensure compliance with applicable accounting standards (IFRS/GAAP). Assist in presenting financial data and insights to stakeholders.
  • Variance Analysis: Conduct variance analysis against budgets and forecasts. Investigate discrepancies and provide financial insights. Support management with data-driven recommendations.
  • Compliance and Controls: Ensure adherence to company policies and internal controls. Manage VAT filings and reconciliations. Oversee PAYE filings and reconciliations. Support statutory compliance requirements.
  • Stakeholder Coordination: Collaborate with AP, AR, Treasury, and cross-functional teams. Support client communication related to financial reporting.
  • Management Accounts: Prepare P&L statements, Balance Sheets, and Cash Flow analysis. Provide analytical insights to support decision-making.
  • Audit Support: Coordinate with auditors and provide required documentation. Address audit queries and assist in implementing corrective actions.
  • Process Improvement: Identify opportunities to enhance efficiency within the R2R process. Support system improvements and reporting automation in Xero and other ERP systems.
  • Sales KPI Reporting: Develop and maintain sales performance reports and KPIs. Analyze revenue trends and provide actionable insights.

Preferred Skills & Qualifications

  • Strong hands-on experience in Record-to-Report (R2R) or similar finance roles.
  • Solid knowledge of accounting principles and standards (IFRS/GAAP).
  • Proficiency in Xero and other ERP systems.
  • Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel for financial modeling, reconciliations, and data analysis.
  • Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills.
  • Ability to manage multiple tasks and meet tight deadlines in a dynamic environment.
  • Strong understanding of month-end close processes, reconciliations, and financial reporting.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Professional certification (e.g., ACCA, CPA, CMA) is an advantage.
  • Experience working with SME clients in a fast-paced, multi-entity environment.
  • Exposure to international accounting and reporting standards.

Why Join Us?

  • Opportunity to work with a diverse portfolio of SME clients.
  • Exposure to international accounting and financial reporting standards.
  • Collaborative, performance-driven, and growth-oriented work environment.
  • Clear learning and career progression opportunities.
summary: Financial Analyst – R2R role requiring 2-4 years of experience in financial reporting, reconciliations, and compliance using Xero and ERP systems. Proficiency in IFRS/GAAP and Excel essential for accurate month-end closes and stakeholder support.

TECHVANTAGE SYSTEMS (P) Ltd

Module L1A, Level -1, Thejaswini, Technopark, Trivandrum and 2nd floor, Amstor House, Technopark campus, phase-1, Trivandrum , 695581 http://www.techvantagesystems.com

Senior Cloud Engineer

Closing Date: 28, Feb 2026 Job Published: 17, Feb 2026 Contact Email: jobs@techvantagesystems.com

Brief Description

We are building a dedicated Cloud Operations (CloudOps) function to establish strong operational ownership, governance discipline, and financial accountability across a complex Azure environment. The Senior Cloud Engineer will be part of the founding CloudOps team and will serve as an operational authority responsible for platform reliability, governance enforcement, cost control, and risk management. This role is focused on protecting the Azure estate, enforcing guardrails, and translating business risk into technical controls.

This is not a DevOps enablement or application delivery role. The mandate is to ensure structured, auditable, and cost-governed cloud operations by clearly defining boundaries between CloudOps, Platform Engineering, and Application Development teams.

Roles & Responsibilities

  1. Azure Operational Ownership
  2. Own Azure operational reliability, uptime, and overall platform readiness across production and non-production environments
  3. Ensure structured environment management across subscriptions and management groups

  4. Maintain formal operational discipline including runbooks, SOPs, and change control processes

  5. Incident & Risk Management

  6. Lead incident response and coordinate major incident handling
  7. Perform root cause analysis (RCA) and drive permanent remediation

  8. Establish preventive controls to reduce recurring incidents

  9. Governance & Guardrails Enforcement

  10. Design and enforce Azure governance guardrails including:
    • Azure Policy
    • RBAC
    • Privileged Identity Management (PIM)
    • Naming conventions
    • Tagging standards
  11. Identify and remediate governance drift
  12. Correct over-permissioned access models and unsafe deployment pipelines

  13. Ensure strict separation of operational responsibilities between CloudOps, Platform Engineering, and Application teams

  14. FinOps & Cost Accountability

  15. Own FinOps execution across the Azure estate
  16. Drive rightsizing initiatives and cost optimization programs
  17. Manage reservations and savings plans
  18. Implement cost allocation and spend accountability models

  19. Enforce cost guardrails aligned to business risk tolerance

  20. AKS Platform Operations

  21. Operate Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS) with strong platform ownership
  22. Implement scaling discipline and node-level cost optimization

  23. Define and enforce workload responsibility boundaries

  24. Infrastructure as Code Governance

  25. Oversee operational integrity of IaC deployments (ARM, Bicep, Terraform)
  26. Ensure IaC aligns with governance, compliance, and security controls
  27. Prevent bypass of guardrails through automation pipelines

Preferred Skills

Mandatory Skill Set - 6+ years of hands-on Azure experience with direct production accountability - Strong ownership of: - Azure Subscriptions - Management Groups - Networking Architecture - Identity & Access Management (IAM) - Deep understanding of Azure governance frameworks - Hands-on experience with: - Azure Policy - RBAC - PIM - Azure Landing Zones - Strong FinOps knowledge including rightsizing, reservations, savings plans, and cost optimization strategies - Operational experience with Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS) - Strong knowledge of Infrastructure as Code: - ARM - Bicep - Terraform - Experience identifying and correcting governance drift - Experience handling over-permissioned environments and risky access models - Strong incident management and root cause analysis capability - Clear understanding that Operations, DevOps, and Development are separate disciplines

Good to Have Skill Set - Experience building Azure governance operating models from scratch - Exposure to multi-subscription enterprise Azure estates - Experience implementing Azure cost allocation models - Automation scripting (PowerShell / Azure CLI) - Exposure to audit and compliance frameworks - Experience in regulated environments

Mandatory Certifications

  • AZ-305 – Azure Solutions Architect Expert
  • AZ-104 – Azure Administrator
  • AZ-140 – Azure Virtual Desktop
  • AZ-900 – Azure Fundamentals
  • ITIL 4 Foundation (Strongly Preferred)
summary: Senior Cloud Engineer at Techvantage Systems focuses on Azure governance, FinOps, and AKS operations. Requires 6+ years of Azure experience and specific certifications.

Address: 3rd & 5th FLOORS, M SQUARED BUILDING, ANNEX 2, TECHNOPARK CAMPUS, KARIYAVATTOM, TRIVANDRUM, KERALA , 695581 Website: https://www.kenland.in Contact Email: recruiter@kenland.in

Job Title

Junior Dot Net Developer

Closing Date

15, Mar 2026

Job Published

16, Feb 2026

Responsibilities

  • Develop, test, and deploy ASP.NET MVC applications.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define and implement new features.
  • Debug and resolve software issues to ensure optimal performance.
  • Participate in code reviews and follow best coding practices.
  • Maintain and improve existing applications, identifying areas for optimization.
  • Stay updated with the latest technologies and ASP.NET best practices.
  • Document code and technical designs for future reference.
  • Provide basic technical support and troubleshooting for applications in production.

Preferred Skills

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.
  • Strong knowledge of C# programming language.
  • Experience in software development with .NET Core.
  • Familiarity with HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and jQuery.
  • Basic experience with front-end frameworks like Bootstrap.
  • Understanding of relational databases, Entity Framework, and ORM tools (Dapper).
  • Knowledge of version control systems like Git.
  • Good problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
  • Ability to work effectively in a collaborative team environment.
  • A positive attitude, willingness to learn, and adaptability to project requirements.
  • Basic understanding of object-oriented programming (OOP) principles.
  • Experience in writing SQL queries and working with relational databases.
  • Exposure to RESTful APIs and Web Services.
  • Understanding of Agile methodologies.
  • Knowledge of cloud platforms like Azure.
summary: KENLAND IT SOLUTIONS seeks a Junior Dot Net Developer to design, develop, and maintain web applications using ASP.NET MVC and .NET Core. Requires 1-2 years of experience with C#, ASP.NET, and related technologies.
